sections.title: Digitally designed, 3D-printed veneer restorations — crafted with calm precision.
sections.body: We use high-precision scanning and digital smile planning to design ultra-thin, custom veneer restorations for carefully selected cases. You’ll get clear options, honest guidance, and a clinician-led plan — whether a printed resin restoration, ceramic veneer, or another approach is best for you.
bullets: Scans map veneer thickness and edge transitions
Mock-ups you can review before we finalise
Polishing passes planned for a natural sheen
Discussing when porcelain remains the gold standard

sections.title: Planned fit with clinician oversight
items: Digital design keeps margins and contacts clean
Trial prints help confirm edge length and symmetry
Finishing guided by your bite and lip line
Clear guidance when to step up to porcelain
Regulated dental materials matched to their indication

sections.title: 3D printed veneers in Shoreham-by-Sea
sections.body:
These are digitally designed veneer restorations created from medical-grade dental resin using high-precision 3D printing. They’re planned from detailed scans and smile design previews, then finished and fitted with a focus on comfort, fit, and a highly conservative approach where clinically appropriate.

Suitability varies — your bite, enamel quality, and long-term goals decide whether a printed resin restoration, ceramic veneer, or another option is the best match.
bullets: Digital smile design preview before we start
Highly conservative preparation in suitable cases
Custom-made restorations produced from precise scans
Planned around your bite and long-term maintenance

sections.title: Digital smile design with face-driven previews
sections.body: Intraoral scanning, calibrated photographs, and Digital Smile Design guide printed veneer contours so they follow your lips, speech, and bite. Trial smiles help confirm the plan before any enamel changes.
bullets: Intraoral scans map enamel thickness, contacts, and occlusion
Digital Smile Design aligned to your facial midline and smile curve (/treatments/digital-smile-design)
Face-driven aesthetics to balance gum levels, phonetics, and tooth proportions
3D printed trial smiles or mock-ups to review length and edge position
Shade planning coordinated with whitening hub steps when appropriate (/treatments/teeth-whitening)
Alternatives like composite bonding for limited refinements when more conservative (/treatments/composite-bonding)
sections.mediaHint: Digital smile design and trial smile workflow

items: People wanting a previewable veneer option before porcelain
Cases where small shape or edge changes are needed

Those needing conservative enamel preservation
Patients who want digital check-ins before committing

sections.eyebrow: Porcelain veneers vs digitally designed / 3D printed veneers
sections.title: Printed vs ceramic veneers — what’s different?
sections.body: Ceramic (porcelain) veneers and digitally printed veneer restorations are made from different materials and produced in different ways. Ceramic veneers are a long-established option. Printed restorations use modern scanning and printing technology to create precise, ultra-thin restorations for carefully selected cases. The right choice depends on your bite, goals, and long-term plan — not one material ‘winning’ for everyone.
items: Ceramic veneers (porcelain) — A long-established, lab-made option with excellent aesthetics and colour stability. Often chosen where a definitive ceramic solution is appropriate.

Digitally printed veneer restorations — A modern digital restorative option produced from scans and 3D printing workflows. Can be highly conservative in suitable cases and is planned around individual bite and function.

sections.title: Digitally designed, 3D-printed veneer restorations
sections.body: We offer advanced digitally designed veneer restorations using high-precision scanning and 3D printing technology. These restorations are custom designed from digital scans and printed from biocompatible dental resins used internationally in advanced restorative dentistry. The aim is a precise fit, controlled thickness, and a conservative approach — always guided by clinical judgement and careful case selection.
items: Precision fit from digital scans — We design from detailed 3D scans so the restoration is planned in relation to your tooth shape, contact points, and bite.
Ultra-thin, conservative designs (when suitable) — In the right cases, we can minimise tooth preparation and still achieve a meaningful aesthetic change.
Digitally repeatable workflow — Digital planning improves consistency and makes it easier to refine the design across appointments if needed.
Hand-finished by your clinician — Printed restorations are shaped, finished, and polished carefully by hand for a natural, bespoke result.
Case selection + bite planning first — We assess bite forces, tooth position, enamel, and habits (like grinding) before recommending printed veneer restorations.
Staged treatment planning options — Depending on your situation, these restorations may be used as long-term or medium-term aesthetic solutions, or as part of a staged plan.
sections.strapline: We outline when printed veneers are appropriate and when a ceramic route may be recommended.

sections.title: Materials and finishing
sections.body: We use biocompatible dental resins supplied for regulated dental applications and process them strictly according to manufacturer instructions. The final restoration is then finished and polished by hand to refine shape, texture, and shine. If ceramic is the better option for your goals or bite, we’ll tell you clearly.
items: Biocompatible dental resins — Chosen for clinical suitability and processed under manufacturer guidelines.
Hand-finished and polished — Designed digitally, then refined by hand for a natural result.
Honest guidance on alternatives — Where ceramic or another restoration is more appropriate, we’ll recommend it.

sections.title: Caring for printed veneers
items: Printed veneers are not maintenance-free — hygiene visits protect margins and gums
Avoid very hard foods while edges settle and report any edge lifting
Chipping, wear, or staining can occur; we can repolish or refresh when needed
Night guards are advised if you clench to protect edges and bonding
We’ll signal when a porcelain upgrade is safer for longevity

sections.title: What to consider before choosing printed veneer restorations
sections.body: Printed veneer restorations can be an excellent option in carefully selected cases — but suitability depends on bite forces, tooth position, enamel, and long-term maintenance. We’ll explain what’s realistic for your smile and help you choose the option that fits your plan and priorities.
items: Longevity varies by bite and habits
Maintenance and review matter
Case selection is key

sections.title: Explore options around printed veneers
sections.strapline: Compare complementary treatments and planning steps that often pair well with digitally designed veneer restorations. We’ll always help you choose what fits your bite, lifestyle, and long-term plan.

sections.title: What to consider before choosing printed veneers

faqs.question: How long do digitally designed or printed veneers last?
faqs.answer: Longevity depends on bite forces, tooth position, habits such as grinding, and how the restorations are looked after. We’ll plan for durability and talk you through realistic expectations for your individual case.

faqs.question: What do printed veneers cost?
faqs.answer: They are typically the most affordable veneer route. We explain how costs differ from composite bonding and porcelain so you can choose the right stage for you.

faqs.question: Who are printed veneers suitable for?
faqs.answer: Suitability is decided after a full assessment of enamel, alignment, bite forces, and aesthetic goals. If printed veneer restorations aren’t right for you, we’ll recommend a better alternative.

faqs.question: What maintenance do printed veneers need?
faqs.answer: Expect hygiene visits, occasional polishing, and night guard wear if you clench. Printed veneers can stain or wear sooner than porcelain, so refreshes are planned into your care.

faqs.question: Can I see the smile before committing?
faqs.answer: Yes. Digital previews and printed mock sets let you assess length, symmetry, and shade. We can also discuss whitening or a combined smile makeover if that better matches your goals (/treatments/full-smile-makeover).

sections.title: When this fits and what else to consider
sections.body: In our clinic we usually stage this after smile design planning (/treatments/digital-smile-design) so the plan stays safe and measured.
bullets: Appropriate when you want to find out how 3d printed provisional veneers support smile planning.
Often follows Smile design planning (/treatments/digital-smile-design); Orthodontic alignment (/treatments/orthodontics).
Alternatives we balance: Aligner refinements (/treatments/aligners); Gum contouring and care (/treatments/periodontal-gum-care).

Next steps we plan for: Protect with night guards (/treatments/night-guards-occlusal-splints); Finishing whitening (/treatments/whitening-top-ups); Regular reviews (/treatments/preventative-and-general-dentistry).

sections.title: Veneer Consultation & Smile Design
sections.body: If you’re considering printed resin veneer restorations, we’ll start with a calm, clinician-led assessment and digital preview. We’ll talk you through suitability, alternatives (including ceramic veneers), and how to keep results looking natural and stable over time.

reassurance_intent.label: Protect results with night guard options
